title: Trinidadian Red Beans
description: Ideally, this recipe would use dried kidney beans that have been soaked overnight, then cooked for around 45 minutes. I cheat by using canned beans, resulting in a meal that can easily made midweek. Trini red beans is traditionally served for Sunday lunch, itâ€™s the perfect accompaniment to stew chicken and macaroni pie - but I often just eat it with rice and a side of vegetables.
method: Sweat the onion until sweet and soft, 8-10 minutes. Stir occasionally to prevent the onions catching. In a medium sized sauce pan, sweat the onion until sweet and soft, this will take around 10 minutes. Add a pinch of salt - the salt with help draw moisture out of the onion to let it sweat perfectly.
Add the crushed garlic and cook for a couple of minutes.
Stir through the green seasoning, canned tomatoes and kidney beans (including the water in the can).

Increase the heat and bring to a gentle simmer, then cook for 20-25 minutes to allow the flavours to meld together and the sauce to get thicker. Stir every few minutes to prevent it sticking on the bottom.
Using a fork or a potato masher, squash some of the beans (I like to mash around half of the beans), then mix until the sauce is evenly combined. Season and serve.
